alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 11:21AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR ALL COASTS AND BAYSHORES... .An underwater volcano eruption near Tonga late yesterday has generated at tsunami. A series of water level surges onto and off of the coastline and bayshores is ongoing and expected to continue through the remainder of the day and into the evening. The tsunami has already resulted in rapid swings of up to 3 feet above to below forecast tidal level, or roughly 6 feet change within 30 to 60 minute intervals. The arriving water will come in a surge, similar to a tidal rise, but in a much shorter interval, and not as a shorter period cresting surf or wave. The surge of water onto and off of coastline can dislodge coastal objects, knock around buoyed objects such as boats, and potentially overwhelm individuals on the coast. Very strong currents and undertow are capable of knocking over, overwhelming, and then pulling people out into the cold, restless ocean where hypothermia or drowning are a possibility. Mariners on embarked vessels already off the coast are advised to remain away from the coast until the water levels return to normal fluctuations. ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR ALL COASTS AND BAYSHORES... * UPDATES... The tsunami is ongoing and impacting the Pacific coast and San Francisco bayshore line. Several pulses of rapid rises and falls have been observed and are expected to continue. * LOCAL IMPACTs... For people in the advisory area...A tsunami capable of producing strong currents that may be hazardous to swimmers... boats...and coastal structures is expected. Low lying shallow, or channeled areas (such as harbors and shallow water areas) should expect continued minor to moderate flooding. Several area harbors have reported moderate flooding and damage and further flooding is possible. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS... If you are located in this coastal area...move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. Do not go to the coast to watch the tsunami. Be alert to instructions from your local emergency officials * FORECAST TSUNAMI DURATION... No estimate at this. The Hawaiian Islands were under a tsunami advisory for approximately 11 hours but a longer duration for our area is possible. Thus, expect water levels could decrease below tsunami advisory levels by this evening. * FORECAST PEAK TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS... Rapid fluctuations of 1 to 3 feet above and below forecast levels every 30 to 60 minutes. * OBSERVED TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS FROM EARLIER...Rapid fluctuations of 1 to 3 feet above and below forecast levels every 30 to 60 minutes * PRELIMINARY EARTHQUAKE INFORMATION... An volcanic eruption occurred at 827 PM PST on Jan 14 2022, centered near the Tonga Islands. This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates. This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates.
